p: Except Trinidad and Tobago in 1979 [ 19], the Caribbean has not suffered from YF since 1960. The ongoing YFV circulation in Brazil raises concern regarding viral importation into the Caribbean. However, the requirement of YF vaccination is not mandatory in many Caribbean islands (e.g. Haiti, Cuba), but restricted to the travelers coming from YF-epidemic countries ( http://www.who.int/ith/ITH_country_list.pdf?ua=1). The disease control relies only on the check of vaccination card, which is insufficient for YF prevention. Thus, YF is still a threat for this region where Ae. aegypti is widely distributed. Here, although not based on vertebrate animal transmission model, we demonstrated that Ae. aegypti from Guadeloupe are susceptible to YFV and able to transmit viral particles from 14 days post-infection.
